table.name: mem
table.column: быть гладким, быть плавным, быть без затруднений, быть однородным

table.name: mem
table.column: Your mother has a smooth forehead!
Deine Mutter hat eine glatte Stirn!
مادر شما دارای پیشانی صاف است! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Din mamma har en slät panna! [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a command given to a data transceiving device ({HablI':n}).
Команда отдается устройству для передачи данных ({HablI':n}).

The subtitle says "Ready to transmit", which was the original English line spoken by the actress playing Valkris. However, the Klingon is phrased as a command, so "Prepare to transmit" is a better translation.

table.name: mem
table.column: vara utvecklad, vara högtstående (om t.ex. civilisation)

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {Hagh qoHpu' neH HeghtaHvIS SuvwI'pu'.:sen} ▶ {cheqotlhchugh maHaghbe''a'? cheDuQchugh mareghbe''a'? cheQIHchugh manoDbe''a'?:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: Only fools laugh while warriors die.
Nur Narren lachen während Krieger sterben.
فقط احمق ها می خندند در حالی که رزمندگان می میرند [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Endast dårar skrattar medan krigare dör. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Только дураки смеются, пока умирают воины
戰士死亡之時，只有傻瓜會笑。

table.name: mem
table.column: вымочить, вымачивать, намочить, впитывать, замачивать, смачивать, мокнуть

The object is the thing being soaked or drenched.
{HaH'egh:v@@HaH:v:1, -'egh:v} is used to refer to drinking a great deal, or bathing.

Объектом является вещь, которую мочат или замачивают.
{HaH'egh:v@@HaH:v:1, -'egh:v} использовано, чтобы упомянуть о купании или о том, когда много пьют.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is used by upper-class speakers for {gham:n} served as food.
Dieses Wort wird durch die Oberklasse verwendet, wenn {gham:n} als Nahrung serviert wird.
Слово, используется носителями языка высшего класса для {gham:n} служащего едой

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a famous play by {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}, and also the name of its eponymous protagonist.
Dies ist der Name eines bekannten Stücks von {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}, als auch dessen Hauptfigur.
Название известной пьесы, автором которой является {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}, а также имя одноименного протагониста.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a wound or sore with at least some abrasion, not just a bruise.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a biological unit.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word has a negative connotation in Klingon culture.[1]
Слово имеет негативный оттенок в Клингонской культуре.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word has a negative connotation in Klingon culture.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a doctor (see {Qel:n:1h}) who performs surgery (see {Haq:v:1}).[2]
Dies ist ein Arzt (siehe {Qel:n:1h}) der operiert (siehe {Haq:v:1}).[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: верить, считать(быть в чем-то уверенным), быть убежденным в чем-то

table.name: mem
table.column: In ascending order of ferocity, the verbs used to describe military confrontations are: {Qor:v}, {tlhaS:v}, {vay:v}, {lul:v}, {Hargh:v:nolink}.
В порядке убывания свирепости, используются следующие глаголы, для описания военных противостояний: {Qor:v}, {tlhaS:v}, {vay:v}, {lul:v}, {Hargh:v:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: "Over the Rainbow" was composed by Harold Arlen and its lyrics were written by E.Y. Harburg.

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that {jIH:n:2} refers to the device, while {HaSta:n:nolink} refers to the visual information displayed on it. Also contrast this with {wIy:n}, which can also be displayed on a {jIH:n:2}.
Interesting coincidence: in the Spanish phrase "Hasta la vista" ("see you later"), "la vista" means "the view".

table.name: mem
table.column: In slang, stolen goods are said to be "hot".

table.name: mem
table.column: fly från, ta sig ur, smita ifrån

table.name: mem
table.column: территория или район за пределами чего-то

table.name: mem
table.column: To challenge someone to a duel, say {qablIj HI'ang:sen:nolink}. To accept such a challenge, say {vISo'be':sen:nolink}.[2, p.68]
Чтобы вызвать кого-то на поединок, скажите {qablIj HI'ang:sen:nolink}. Чтобы принять такой вызов, скажите {vISo'be':sen:nolink}.[2, стр.68]

table.name: mem
table.column:
To answer in the affirmative, say {luq:excl} "okay".
To answer in the negative, say {Qo':excl} "no, I refuse".

Чтобы ответить утвердительно, скажите {luq:excl} "Окей".
Чтобы ответить отрицательно, скажите {Qo':excl} "нет, я отказываюсь".
▶ {Ha', pa'lIj wIjaH!:sen:nolink} "Come, let's go to your quarters!" ▶ {Ha', tach wIjaH!:sen:nolink} "Come, let's go to a bar!" ▶ {Ha', vaS'a' wIjaH!:sen:nolink} "Come, let's go to the Great Hall."
▶ {Ha', pa'lIj wIjaH!:sen:nolink} "Давайте, пойдём в вашу каюту!" ▶ {Ha', tach wIjaH!:sen:nolink} "Давайте, пойдём в бар!" ▶ {Ha', vaS'a' wIjaH!:sen:nolink} "Давайте, пойдём в Зал Великого совета."

table.name: mem
table.column: For different ways in which meat may be prepared, see {wamwI' Ha'DIbaH:n}, {voDleH Ha'DIbaH:n}, and {qeyvaq Ha'DIbaH:n}.
Для описания различных способов приготовления мяса, смотрите {wamwI' Ha'DIbaH:n}, {voDleH Ha'DIbaH:n}, и {qeyvaq Ha'DIbaH:n}. Также может использоваться, как легкое оскорбление

table.name: mem
table.column: Do not kill an animal unless you intend to eat it.
Töte kein Tier, wenn du nicht vorhast, es zu essen.
حیوان را کشتن ندهید مگر اینکه قصد داشته باشید آن را بخورید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Död inte ett djur om du inte tänker äta det. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Не убивай животное, если не намерен его съесть!
除非你打算吃它，否則不要殺死動物。

table.name: mem
table.column: This is what Klingons would call the Terran food.
Это то, что Клингоны называют земной пищей

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the little piece of metal that holds sheets of paper together.

table.name: mem
table.column:
The object of {vev:v} is {Ha'on:n}. The papers stapled together are the object of {rar:v}.
To use such a device, one may {qIp:v}, {'uy:v}, or {ngaH:v} it, depending on the particular device.

table.name: mem
table.column: In ancient times, this supported a sword. Now it is symbolic of one's {tuq:n}.
В древние времена использовалась для ношения меча. Сейчас это символ {tuq:n}.

▶ {qorDu'Daj tuq 'oS Ha'quj'e' tuQbogh wo'rIv. tuQtaHvIS Hem. ghaHvaD quHDaj qawmoH.:sen:nolink} "The sash that Worf wears is a symbol of his family's house. He wears it proudly as a reminder of his heritage."[2]

▶ {qorDu'Daj tuq 'oS Ha'quj'e' tuQbogh wo'rIv. tuQtaHvIS Hem. ghaHvaD quHDaj qawmoH.:sen:nolink} "Перевязь, которую носит Ворф, является символом его семьи. Он носит её гордо, как напоминание о его наследии."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The expression {Ha'qujlIj nge':sen:nolink} "take away your sash" means "wound your pride".
Выражение {Ha'qujlIj nge':sen:nolink} "сними свою перевязь" значит "ущеми свою гордость".

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word can only refer to a physical path, and not to a spiritual or metaphorical path. "The Klingon Way", for example, is {tlhIngan tIgh:n:nolink}.
A physical path would be a {taw:n}.

Слово может относиться только к физическому пути, а не к духовному или метафорическому. "Клингонский путь", к примеру будет {tlhIngan tIgh:n:nolink}.
Другое слово для обозначения физического пути {taw:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Hevetlh wIghoSchugh, veH tIn wI'el maH'e'.
That course will take us into the Barrier as well.
Wenn wir jenem Kurs folgen, überschreiten wir die große Grenze.
این دوره ما را به سمت مانع نیز خواهد برد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Den kursen tar oss också in i barriären. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
但這樣的話我們也會駛向大屏障。

table.name: mem
table.column: Neuer Kurs in die Neutrale Zone setzen.
دوره جدید، منطقه بی طرف فدراسیون. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Новый курс, нейтральная зона с Федерацией

table.name: mem
table.column: Plan den Kurs, null-null-null, mark zwei.
قطعه صفر صفر صفر، علامت دو. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {Ha'DIbaH DaSop 'e' DaHechbe'chugh yIHoHQo'.:sen} ▶ {Hem tlhIngan Segh 'ej maHemtaH 'e' wIHech.:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: retreat perfectly, make a full withdrawal
عقب نشینی کنید، یک خروج کامل بگیرید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
reträtt perfekt, gör en fullständig återkallelse [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: The fact that {yIn:v} can be used transitively suggests that {Hegh:v:nolink} can be too.
Фактически {yIn:v} может быть использована транзитивно. Как и {Hegh:v:nolink}.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: ▶ {Hegh Duj DatIj 'ej ghe'torDaq Duqeng.:sen:nolink} "Barge of the Dead ferries you to Gre'thor!"
▶ {Hegh Duj DatIj 'ej ghe'torDaq Duqeng.:sen:nolink} "Баржа мертвых переправит тебя в Гретор!"

table.name: mem
table.column: A fool's only achievement is death.
Das einzige, was ein Narr erreicht, ist der Tod.
En dum är bara prestation är döden. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
傻瓜的唯一成就就是死亡。

table.name: mem
table.column: This may also be written as {Heghba':n:nolink}.
It is written {Heghba':n:nolink} in the novel "Sarek".

table.name: mem
table.column: When a warrior dies, his spirit escapes.
Wenn ein Krieger stirbt, entflieht sein Geist.
هنگامی که یک جنگجو می میرد، روح او فرار می کند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
När en krigare dör, flyr hans anda. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Когда воин умирает, его дух вырывается
當一個戰士死去時，他的靈魂逃脫了。
The verb {nargh:v:2} means "escape", but it (or a phonetically identical word) also means "appear" (see {nargh:v:1}).
Глагол {nargh:v:2} означает "сбегать", но он также значит "появляться" (см. {nargh:v:1}).

table.name: mem
table.column: Death is an experience best shared.
Der Tod ist eine Erfahrung, die man am besten teilt.
مرگ یک تجربه به اشتراک گذاشته شده است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Döden är en erfarenhet som är bäst delad. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Смерть это опыт, который передается лучше всего
死亡之經驗最佳是分享的。

table.name: mem
table.column: It is a good day to die.
Heute ist ein guter Tag zum Sterben.
Det är en bra dag att dö. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: быть фатальным, быть смертельным, быть роковым
The definition in {TKD:src} only says "be fatal", but it's clear that the verb takes an object since it is formed using {-moH:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: In {TNK:src}, {bIQ'a' HeH:n} is used to translate "beach". In the {paq'batlh:src}, {ngeng HeH:n} is used to translate "lakeshore".
In {TNK:src} wird {bIQ'a' HeH:n} für "Strand" verwendet. Im {paq'batlh:src} wird {ngeng HeH:n} für "Seeufer" verwendet.
В {TNK:src}, {bIQ'a' HeH:n} используется, как "берег моря". В {paq'batlh:src}, {ngeng HeH:n} используется, как "берег озера".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is an admirable trait and does not carry connotations of arrogance, for which see {nguq:v}.
Используется в контексте восхищения. Для описания высокомерия, смотрите {nguq:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Klingons are a proud race, and we intend to go on being proud.
Klingonen sind eine stolze Rasse, und wir haben vor weiterhin stolz zu sein.
کلینگان ها یک مسابقه افتخار هستند و ما قصد داریم تا افتخار کنیم. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Klingons är en stolt ras, och vi tänker fortsätta att vara stolta. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Клингоны гордая раса и мы намерены продолжать быть гордыми
克林崗人是一種自豪的民族，和我們打算繼續自豪。

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a character from a play by {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}, and also the name of the play itself.
Это имя персонажа из пьесы {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}, а также имя персонажа.

table.name: mem
table.column: finger (holes, strings of instrument) to vary sound
mit den Fingern die Luftlöcher öffnen und schließen (spielen eines Blasinstrumentes)
انگشت (سوراخ، رشته ابزار) برای تغییر صدا [AUTOTRANSLATED]
fingra på (hål, strängar på instrument) för att variera ljud
手指（孔、樂器弦）改變聲音 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This word is applied to {SuSDeq:n} and {HurDagh:n}.
See under {nItlh:n} for the verbs associated with each of the fingers.

table.name: mem
table.column: This was defined as "hail" among other weather words. The "weather" clarification was added to distinguish it from the communication sense of "hail" ({rI':v}).

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {qarDaSQa'Daq ruDelya' rop'a' Hergh qengbogh yo' Dabot.:sen:nolink} "Intercept Rudellian plague relief convoy to Cardassian Union."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: Man kann dies auch als {HerghwI':n:nolink} abkürzen.

table.name: mem
table.column: R. Hess was a famous war criminal.

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {tam; Hew rur}.
Es gibt die Redewendung {tam; Hew rur}.

table.name: mem
table.column: battle or fight against one's own group
نبرد یا مبارزه با گروه خودتان [AUTOTRANSLATED]
slåss eller slåss mot sin egen grupp [AUTOTRANSLATED]
вести бой или сражаться с собственной группой
與自己的團體作戰或戰鬥 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This verb indicates fighting against one's own group, and not the supposed enemy.
Dies bedeutet seine eigene Leute bekämpfen, anstatt den Feind.
Глагол обозначает сражение против своей собственной группы, а не с предполагаемым врагом.
This may have been a back-fit for a mispronunciation of {Hegh:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The components of an atom may include {yomIj:n}, {valtIn:n}, and {tem:n}.
The Atomium is a famous building in Heysel, Brussels.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to the emission of odor. It does not have the idiomatic sense of "be very bad" as the word "stink" does in English.
Это слово относится к выделения запаха. Она не имеет смысла "дурной запах"

table.name: mem
table.column: This song is a translation of "Kiss Me" by the band Sixpence None the Richer.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This literally means "Come towards me!"
Watch Gowron say this: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/Wq5mvIWRSKc}

Wörtlich bedeutet dies "Komm zu mir!"
Siehe wie Gowron dies sagt: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/Wq5mvIWRSKc}

Дословно это означает "Идите ко мне!"
Смотрите, как Гаурон говорит это: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/Wq5mvIWRSKc}

table.name: mem
table.column: {HIj:v:nolink} is used for transporting goods, whereas it seems that {lup:v} is used for transporting people.
▶ {yIHmey DaHIj'a'? ghobe', yIHmey vIHIjbe'.} "Are you transporting tribbles? No. I'm not transporting tribbles."[2]
▶ {yIHmey DaHIj'a'? ghobe', yIHmey vIHIjbe'.} "Вы перевозите трибблов?Нет.Я не перевожу трибблов."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: بله، درست (پاسخ به بله / بدون سوال) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
是的、是的（回答是/否問題） [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This is the positive answer to a yes/no question (see {-'a':v}). Unlike the English word "yes", it is not used as a stand-alone exclamation indicating insight, joy, and so on (for which see {toH:excl} and {Qapla'!:sen}). For an exclamation indicating compliance, such as in response to a command, see {lu':excl}.
Watch Gowron say this: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/KArQlviVXMk}

Это положительный ответ на вопрос да\нет (см. {-'a':v}).
Смотрите, как это говорит Гаурон: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/KArQlviVXMk}
Looks like a combination of the Japanese and German affirmative answers ("hai" and "ja").

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the clothing worn in battle.
Bezeichnet die Kleidung, die im Kampf getragen wird.
In English slang, "hip" means fashionable in the context of clothing.

table.name: mem
table.column: To find ale, go into a bar.
Um Bier zu finden, musst du in die Kneipe gehen.
برای پیدا کردن آل، به یک نوار بروید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
För att hitta ale, gå in i en bar. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Чтобы найти эль, идите в бар!
要找到啤酒，請進入酒吧。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: گیر کرده (از لحاظ جسمی به چیزی وصل شده) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
卡住（物理上固定在某物上） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This describes how a stamp is stuck to an evelope or a wad of spit is stuck to the wall.
This was defined as "be stuck" with an explanation, along with a bunch of other words which can be translated into various senses of "be stuck" in English.

table.name: mem
table.column: This line was spoken in Klingon but was not subtitled.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is known as a tourist drink.

table.name: mem
table.column: بله، درست (پاسخ به بله / بدون سوال) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
是的、是的（回答是/否問題） [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: فقط احمق ها حمله نمی کنند [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: A ship cloaks in order to attack.
Ein Schiff tarnt sich, um anzugreifen.
Ett fartyg kappar för att attackera. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
一艘船為了攻擊而斗篷。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: In the {paq'batlh:n}, {molor:n:name} is referred to as a {HI''a':n:nolink} "tyrant" throughout.

table.name: mem
table.column: همه، همه، همه چیز، هر کدام [AUTOTRANSLATED]
alla, allihop, allt, allting, varje, varenda

If {Hoch:n:nolink} is followed by a noun which is explicitly plural, it means "all the X's", taken collectively. If the following noun is not explicitly plural, then it means "each X", considered individually.[2]
If {Hoch:n:nolink} follows a noun, it means "all of X".[3; 4] Note that this is different from {naQ:v} following a noun, which means "a complete X".

Если существительное, что следует за данным словом, во множественном числе, то это значит "все X", вместе взятые. Если подлежащее не совсем во множественном числе(т.е имеются сомнения), тогда это означает "каждый X", в отдельности.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: end, last item in a list
پایان، آخرین مورد در یک لیست [AUTOTRANSLATED]
конец, окончание, завершение, граница, последний пункт списка
結束、列表中的最後一項 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: The sentence from {SkyBox 15:src} seems to have the {wa'DIch:n} in the wrong place. Also, the second occurrence of {vatlh DIS poH:n} is missing a space.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is an emphatic alternative for {reH:adv}.
▶ {Hochlogh no' yIquvmoH.:sen:nolink} "Always honor your ancestors", literally, "All times honor your ancestors".

table.name: mem
table.column: The example sentence was MO's reply to the interviewer who asked him to choose his favourite Star Trek technology. He chose the transporter beam ({jol:n}).
▶ {Hoch Holmey mughwI' vIwIv 'e' DapIH'a'?:sen@@Hoch Holmey mughwI':n, vI-:v, wIv:v, 'e':n, Da-:v, pIH:v:1, -'a':v} "Did you expect me to choose the Universal Translator?"

table.name: mem
table.column: Pity the warrior who slays all his foes.
Bemitleide den Krieger, der alle seine Feinde geschlagen hat.
متاسفم برای جنگجویی که تمام دشمنانش را می‌کشد.
Synd krigare som slår alla sina fiender. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
可憐殺死他所有敵人的戰士。

This is a famous line from the poem {lu qeng:n:name,nolink} by G'trok. The idiomatic expression {Hoch jaghpu'Daj HoHpu':sen:nolink} "He/she has killed all his/her enemies" means that a person leads a meaningless, empty life, one lacking any challenge.

table.name: mem
table.column: هر احتمالی را در نظر بگیرید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This idiomatic expression, which is based on the homophony of the words {nuH:n:1} and {nuH:n:2}, means "to consider every possibility" or "to consider every option".
▶ {Hoch nuH yIqel!:sen:nolink} "Consider every possibility!" ▶ {Hoch nuH Daqel'a'?:sen:nolink} "Did you consider every option?"

table.name: mem
table.column: Eat everything or you will die without honor.
Wenn du nicht alles aufisst, wirst du nicht ehrenhaft sterben.
خوردن همه چیز و یا شما بدون افتخار می میرند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Ät allt eller du kommer att dö utan ära. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
如果你不吃哂一切，你的死而會沒有榮譽。
This is roughly like saying, "Eat, eat!"
QI'lop, Eat everything or you will die without honour.

table.name: mem
table.column: تمام فرصت ها را ضبط کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is the 5th rank of {yaS:n}.
Watch Gowron say this: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/9CTfqKn383I}

Это 5-й ранг {yaS:n}.
Смотрите, как это говорит Гаурон: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/9CTfqKn383I}

table.name: mem
table.column:
The Klingon week has six days, which are: ▶ {DaSjaj:n} "Monday" ▶ {povjaj:n} "Tuesday" ▶ {ghItlhjaj:n} "Wednesday" ▶ {loghjaj:n} "Thursday" ▶ {buqjaj:n} "Friday" ▶ {lojmItjaj:n} or {ghInjaj:n} "Saturday"
If an alien calendar contains more than six days, additional days are numbered beginning with {wa':n:num}. Thus, "Sunday" would be {jaj wa':n}. The eighth day of the week on {lenmaq:n}, which uses an eight-day week, is called {jaj cha':n:nolink}, and so on.[2]

Клингонская неделя имеет 6 дней, которыми являются: ▶ {DaSjaj:n} "Понедельник" ▶ {povjaj:n} "Вторник" ▶ {ghItlhjaj:n} "Среда" ▶ {loghjaj:n} "Четверг" ▶ {buqjaj:n} "Пятница" ▶ {lojmItjaj:n} or {ghInjaj:n} "Суббота"
Если инопланетный календарь состоит более чем из 6 дней, дополнительные дни нумеруются начиная с {wa':n:num}. Таким образом, "Воскресенье" будет {jaj wa':n}. Восьмой день недели {jaj cha':n:nolink}, и так далее.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: 羅慕蘭獵人殺手探測器 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is short for {romuluSngan Sambogh 'ej HoHbogh nejwI':n}.
Это сокращенный вариант слова {romuluSngan Sambogh 'ej HoHbogh nejwI':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is simply the verb {HoH:v} with the suffix {-'egh:v}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: быть осторожным, быть осмотрительным, быть предусмотрительным

table.name: mem
table.column:
In Klingon, names of languages are formed by attaching {Hol:n:nolink} to an identifier for the language. For example, "Klingon" (the language) is {tlhIngan Hol:n}, and {tlhIngan:n} by itself does not refer to the language, but to a person or people.
The identifier is usually a country, region, or political unit of some kind. For example, Federation Standard (i.e., "English") is {DIvI' Hol:n}. {tlhIngan Hol:n:nolink} is actually a shortened form of {tlhIngan wo' Hol:n:nolink}.[2]

В Клингонском, названия языков сформированы путем прикрепления {Hol:n:nolink} к соответствующему названию языка. Например, "Клингонский язык" {tlhIngan Hol:n}, а {tlhIngan:n} сам по себе относится не к языку, а к личности.
Идентификатором обычно является страна, регион, или политический блок. Например, Стандарт Федерации (т.e., "Английский") будет {DIvI' Hol:n}. {tlhIngan Hol:n:nolink} сокращенная форма {tlhIngan wo' Hol:n:nolink}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: slang, "färskt språk" (mestadels använt av yngre klingoner)
This term is used by younger Klingons to refer to the way they prefer to speak.

table.name: mem
table.column: In Klingon, this is a command rather than a question. It literally means, "Identify the languages which you speak!"

table.name: mem
table.column: This is also the name of the journal of the {tlhIngan Hol yejHaD:n}.
Это также название журнала {tlhIngan Hol yejHaD:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This term does not appear in canon, but is an obvious construction from {Hol:n} and {tej:n}.
{Holtej:n:name,nolink} (no space) is the Klingon name of linguist and Klingonist d'Armond Speers.

table.name: mem
table.column: weakling, runt, scrawny one, skinny one
vekling, liten en, mager en, utmärglad person
弱者、矮子、骨瘦如柴、骨瘦如柴 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Due to the homophony with {Hom:n:2}, to point one's second toe at someone (typically an opponent or an enemy), while the other toes point downwards, is considered an insulting gesture. It signifies that one considers the other person to be weak.
▶ {jaghwI'Daq jIHom.:sen:nolink} "I claim my enemy is unworthy or weak."

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb can take {'e':n:pro} as its object.[2]
▶ {tlhIngan Hol Dajatlh 'e' vIHon.:sen:nolink} "I doubt that you speak Klingon."[2]
▶ {tlhIngan Hol Dajatlh 'e' vIHon.:sen:nolink} "Я сомневаюсь, что ты говоришь на Клингонском."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This verb is used in the same way as {Sum:v} (it involves the concept of deixis).[2]
In Klingon, "deep space" is called {logh Hop:n}, literally, "far space".[3]

Этот глагол используется, так же как и {Sum:v}.[2]
В Клингонском, "глубокий космос" будет {logh Hop:n}, что дословно значит, "дальний космос".[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: The pun seems to be {Hoq:n} "expedition" = "trek", and {ra':v} "order", and hence "trekorder" = "tricorder". Another theory says that the "Expedition" is a model of adult tricycle ("trike").

table.name: mem
table.column: be honored falsely, be falsely honorable
به دروغ محترم بماند، به اشتباه محترم شمرده شود [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara falskt ärad, vara felaktigt hedrad
被虛假地稱讚、是虛假的光榮 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Deception is implied by the use of this verb.
This word is used in places where {quv:v} might be used, but when the honor was discovered to be illegitimate. For exampe, a {Duy quv:n:nolink} who turns out to be a spy would be called a {Duy HoQ:n:nolink}.
It differs from {quvHa':v} in that it indicates that one has demanded respect which is unearned or undeserved. A warrior who shows cowardice in battle is a {SuvwI' quvHa':n:nolink}. One who hides his cowardice, is awarded for valor (i.e., becomes known as a {SuvwI' quv:n:nolink}), and is subsequently discovered to be a fraud, is a {SuvwI' HoQ:n:nolink}.
Do not use this word lightly as it has very bad connotations in Klingon society.
be honoured falsely, be falsely honourable

table.name: mem
table.column:
There is an idiom, {HoS; 'Iw rur}.
This verb is also used for regular polygons and polyhedra.[2]

Есть идиома, {HoS; 'Iw rur}.
Глагол также используется для обычных многоугольников и многогранников.[2]
▶ {vagh reD mey' HoS:n@@vagh reD mey':n, HoS:v} "regular pentagon"[2]
▶ {vagh reD mey' HoS:n@@vagh reD mey':n, HoS:v} "обычный пятиугольник"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a device which changes energy from one form to another.
Это устройство, что преобразует одну форму энергии в другую.

table.name: mem
table.column: You are a total waste of good energy!
تو خالی از انرژی خوب هستی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Du är ett totalt slöseri med god energi! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
你是一個完全浪費能量的人！

table.name: mem
table.column: {pIraqSIS:n} is an important Klingon energy facility.
▶ {pIraqSIS HoS waw' ghajlu'chugh, loSlogh boq'egh mI' naghmey mI'; chen qav'ap.:sen:nolink} "If Praxis Energy Facility is owned, rent is 4 times amount shown on dice."

table.name: mem
table.column: It's not clear if this word is grammatically singular or plural. One energy being is a {HoS Dep:n:nolink} (see {HoS:n}, {Dep:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: The term {HoS Hal:n:nolink} (with a space) has also appeared in canon. See the example under {nISwI' beH:n}.

▶ {HoSHal ghajchugh vay', mI' naghmey tIronmoH. wa'maHlogh boq'egh mI' naghmey; chen qav'ap. ghajwI'vaD qav'ap yIDIl.:sen:nolink} "If [energy source is] owned, throw dice and pay owner a total ten times amount shown."

table.name: mem
table.column: The homophonous {Hotlh:v:2} suggests that this verb refers to the combined act of both capturing and displaying an image.
Имеется омофон {Hotlh:v:2} прпедполагающий, что глагол относится к совмещенному действию захвата и показа изображения.

table.name: mem
table.column: The homophonous {Hotlh:v:1} suggests that this verb refers to the combined act of both capturing and displaying an image.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to an astronomical body, and not to the geometric figure, for which see {DujtlhuQ:n}.
Относится к астрономическому телу, а не к геометрической фигуре, для которой смотрите {DujtlhuQ:n}.
This is defined in {TKD:src} only as "star". The "astronomy" part was added for clarification.

table.name: mem
table.column: Hov ghajbe'bogh ram rur pegh ghajbe'bogh jaj.
A day without secrets is like a night without stars.
Ein Tag ohne Geheimnisse ist wie eine Nacht ohne Sterne.
یک روز بدون اسرار مانند یک شب بدون ستاره است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
En dag utan hemligheter är som en natt utan stjärnor. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
沒有秘密的一天就像一個沒有星星的夜晚。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a symbolic representation of the constellation {ghochwI':n}.
This is only spoken in Klingon in {KCD:src}, with no English translation. It is unclear whether it's one word or two.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a popular television franchise. It includes the following series: ▶ The Original Series ▶ The Animated Series ▶ The Next Generation ({puq poH veb:n}) ▶ Deep Space Nine ({logh Hop Hut tengchaH:n}) ▶ Voyager ▶ Enterprise ({'entepray':n:name}) ▶ Discovery ({DISqa'vI'rIy:n:name})

table.name: mem
table.column: It really ought to be {Hov leng cham:n:nolink}, but canon is canon.

table.name: mem
table.column: شما ستاره ها را ستایش میکردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is an idiom meaning "I trust you" or "I know you will honor your word".
Эта идиома означает "Я доверяю тебе" или "Я знаю, что ты сдержишь свое слово".

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {tera' poH jaj wa', jar wa', jaj loSDIch, DIS wa'-Hut-Hut-chorgh. HovpoHvetlh latlh nab yIHutlh.:sen:nolink} "Save this Stardate: Sunday, January 4, 1998"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the everyday term. There is a more technical term, but Maltz didn't remember what it was.

table.name: mem
table.column: Aside from its literal meaning as a body part, this word can also be used to refer to the "teeth" on a cogwheel or sprocket wheel (see {Ho':n:3}).
Отдельно от дословного перевода, как части тела, это слово может использоваться, чтобы описать "зубы" на зубчатом колесе или цепном колесе

table.name: mem
table.column: idol, someone worthy of emulation, something deserving of respect
بت، کسی که شایسته تقلید است، چیزی است که مستحق احترام است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
偶像、值得模仿的人、值得尊重的東西 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This word follows the grammatical rules appropriate to its literal meaning (see {Ho':n:1}). It takes the plural suffix {-Du':n:suff} and possessive suffixes such as {-wIj:n:suff}, even when it refers to a person or people.[1, p.152]
This is defined in the {KGT:src} word list only as "idol". The expanded definition above is from p.152.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is obviously related to {Ho':n:1}, but it's unclear which suffix it takes in the plural. However, given the precedent of {Ho':n:2}, it's probable that this takes {-Du':n:suff}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the serrated blade found on a {qutluch:n}.[1, p.61]

table.name: mem
table.column: You have some stuffed to'baj leg in your teeth.
Du hast etwas gestopftes Tobbajbein zwischen den Zähnen.
شما بعضی از دندان ها را در دندان های خود قرار داده اید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Du har lite fyllt to'baj ben i dina tänder. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
你的牙齒裡有一些塞滿了腿的東西。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: There is a Klingon idiom, {Sagh; Ho''oy' rur}.

table.name: mem
table.column: система(подход), метод, способ, образ действий, техника
Note that this refers to a "system" in the sense of a way of doing something. For a physical (or physical-like) system, see {pat:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: There is a book by Dr. Seuss, "Who's in the zoo".

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {Quj wa'DIch MONOPOLY Huch nav qa' tlhIngan QaS:sen:nolink} "Klingon forces replace original MONOPOLY bills"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This literally means "money plate". It is often, but not always, followed by {-Hom:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Don't trust Ferengi who give back money.
Traue keinem Ferengi der Geld zurückgibt.
به Ferengi که به پول پشت سر بگذارند اعتماد نکردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Lita inte på Ferengi som ger tillbaka pengar. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Не доверяй ференги, который возвращает деньги

table.name: mem
table.column: This literally means "money plates". It is often, but not always, followed by {-Hom:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word has no (known) non-slang counterpart.

table.name: mem
table.column: Mt. Hood is the name of a mountain in northern Oregon.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a geographic feature between {SaqSub:n} and {QIStaq:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a district inside {Sa'Qej Sep:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The name of a mountainous planet.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {qaStaHvIS wa' ram loS SaD Hugh SIjlaH qetbogh loD.:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column:
В зависимости от контекста, это слово может означать "желчь".
Смотрите, как Гаурон говорит это: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/tAK-hgXMH-M}

table.name: mem
table.column: One first charges up ({Huj:v:2,nolink}) a device before energizing ({rIH:v}) it.
Некто сперва заряжает ({Huj:v:2,nolink}) устройство, перед его включением ({rIH:v}).

table.name: mem
table.column: быть липким, быть клейким, быть липучим

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that a human ({Human:n:nolink}) is a member of the indigenous sentient species of Earth ({tera':n:place}), whereas Terran ({tera'ngan:n}) refers to any inhabitant of the planet.

table.name: mem
table.column: This animal is known for its speed.
▶ {nom leng Hun nom lengqu' lut:sen:nolink} "Stories travel faster than a Khrun"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {Hung buv rav; patlh Hut:sen:nolink} "Classified Level 9 and Above"[2]
▶ {Hung buv rav; patlh Hut:sen:nolink} "Уровень секретности 9 и выше"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is the general term for a musical instrument with strings ({SIrgh:n}), which one may either pluck ({pang:v}) or strum ({yach:v:2}). To vary the sound, one "fingers" ({Heng:v}) the strings (touch them at different points while plucking or strumming).
Types of {HurDagh:n:nolink} include the {Supghew:n} (small), the {leSpal:n} (medium), and the {tIngDagh:n} (large).

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {wIH; Hur'Iqngan rur}.

table.name: mem
table.column: It's unclear if this means "to be hung up" or "to hang something/someone".

table.name: mem
table.column: too many people or things in a place at once
zu viele Sachen oder Personen an einem Ort auf einmal
بیش از حد بسیاری از مردم و یا چیزهایی در یک مکان در یک بار [AUTOTRANSLATED]
för många människor/saker på samma plats samtidigt
This term is used as a play on words, substituting for the curse {Qu'vatlh:excl} in situations where it is appropriate.
This word was disclosed during a congested drive on Interstate 95 (i.e., {Hut:n}, {vagh:n:1,num}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a small, usually metal, spike typically used for fastening wood.
This is a reference to the industrial rock band "Nine Inch Nails".

table.name: mem
table.column: This literally means "long nail", and refers to the sticks used in some forms of weaving (see {nIq:v}).

table.name: mem
table.column: lack, be without, to not have

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {val; Huy' rur}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word seems to be composed of {Huy':n} and {Dung:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The fact that this is homophonous with {Hu':v} may have to do with how many times one has gotten up (from sleep) since the day in question. Note that {leS:n:nolink} is also homophonous with {leS:v}.
